history.content:
186 is probably your best bet for an easier programming class that's not that hard.

170 has no programming at all, but it's not that easy too. (Closely related to 70)

-----------------

170 has had at least one programming assignment (in the form of a group project / contest) every semester recently since sp15, and based on student feedback, it seems highly likely that this will continue.

It also, in many semesters, has occasional programming assignments on homeworks (e.g. 1 or 2 in most semesters); again, something that is likely to stay the case.

186 is probably your best bet for an easier programming class that's not that hard.

170 has no programming at all, but it's not that easy too. (Closely related to 70)

children.subject: 170 has had 1 programming problem so far this semester

history.content:
I'm a senior finishing up the CS minor and graduating next semester, with 2 more upper division classes left to go. I've taken the 61 series, 70, and 188 already. My phase 1 is coming up on Monday and was wondering:

1. Are non-CS majors still unable to phase 1 CS classes? Should I simply use my phase 1 on other classes in this case?

2. What classes would you recommend for my last 2 here? I want to stay away from classes involving very low level programming (61C is killing me). And tbh I'm not a great programmer, so I would prefer to shy away from the classes that are considered more difficult. Any recommendations for classes I should check out?

Thanks!
history.subject: Senior Finishing the CS Minor
